content.description: This is old school and what I would call a little exciting to lead.
content.protection: Bolts gear for 10 feet of crack.  A 3 or 4 Camalot may be needed to protect move to the arete.
content.location: Climbs the arete on the right edge of the tower when viewed from below Punch and Judy Towers.

content.description: A forgotten near-classic? Maybe if it weren't for the initial rock quality. But if you can get over that and focus on enjoying the very high quality movement, multiple cruxes, and wide variety of holds, you'll probably have a great time on this one. Jams, locks, techy face, and short, overhanging boulder problems await you. Long but fairly safe falls are possible. Clipping the anchors is an adventure...Â Supplemental gear is useful for hanging the draws, after which you can hang longer draws on specific bolts and remove your gear for a RP run, if needed.
content.protection: Bolts, gear 0.2-#2, 2-3 long quickdraws, chain anchors
content.location: Main face of Mammynuns, right of Flight of the Mammynuns.

content.description: Routes on the east and west side.  Rarely visited.
